headline: Trump Nominates New Board Member for Regulator Weighing Rail Merger
summary: President Trump has nominated a new board member to the railroad regulator weighing the proposed $71.5 billion merger between Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern, a month after ousting a Democratic member from the board.  Senior Trump administration officials earlier this week met with Union Pacific Chief Executive Jim Vena and expressed support for the tie-up, Vena told investors Wednesday.  Trump’s new pick to serve on the Surface Transportation Board is Richard Kloster, president of transportation consulting company Integrity Rail Partners.

headline: Union Pacific, Norfolk Southern: Rival alliances bolster merger case
summary: Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern argue rival interline alliances prove their proposed merger enhances railroad competition. The post Union Pacific, Norfolk Southern: Rival alliances bolster merger case appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: Union Pacific CEO Vena says Norfolk Southern merger will win approval
summary: Speaking at a Morgan Stanley Conference, Vena said he has met with senior people in the administration, who called the deal a "win for the country".  The merger faces intense scrutiny from the Surface Transportation Board, which received a notice of intent from the companies on July 30, 2025.
